intro: Boscia carsonii, commonly known as the red bush willow, is a shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its thick, flaky bark and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically red or orange when mature. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Boscia carsonii is also known for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional African medicine.
